Key: Mm...mmmm... Hm? It's... morning?

(Huh? When did I fall asleep? I feel like I was
with everyone just now...)

(That's right, I entered a virtual world to test
out a game. Then I met a mysterious girl... Arusu.
And then everyone was there, and...)

Wait... Oh, that must have been a dream... Right.
There's no way that crazy thing could have been
real.

It sure was a weird dream... Guess I should go
make some breakfast.

Good morning, Kotori. What's the matter? You seem
to be in a bad mood right from the start.
Uh... Arusu?
Yes.
(...So it wasn't a dream.)

Huh? But why is it morning? My memory of yesterday
only goes up to the afternoon...

At that point, I restarted the world. Currently
it's morning because that is the default setting.

We basically started a new game. We're now at
Game Start, Day 1.
I see...
So, why are you in our house?

To observe Shido Itsuka. So I can observe love and
people growing closer.

So you're keeping watch over Shido? Fine, got it.
While you're doing that, let's get going with
Arusu's big plan.

Then Shido, I guess we can start off with you...
making breakfast.

O-Okay. We can eat in the virtual world, right?
I'll get it ready now.

I was curious about what was inside the fridge,
but it looks like I did some grocery shopping.
I don't remember getting these...

The contents of our fridge aren't being uploaded
to the game in real time. I think they were just
randomly prepared.

I didn't change anything else other than summoning
characters for Shido Itsuka to love.

Attainable characters, was it? That's what you
called them... Then Kotori's also—

I-I'm the one responsible for the Fraxinus and by
extension, the simulator...!

Kotori Itsuka was set to be an attainable
character from the beginning.

Ngh... Y-You said you didn't change any other
settings, right?
Yes. This world was originally designed for that.

Not surprising... There are all these typical gal
game tropes in here.

Come to think of it, when I first logged in,
everyone bumped into me with toast in
their mouths...

Well, they were NPCs. But I see. The general
outline hasn't changed.

Uh, Kotori. I know it's important to figure it all
out, but let's get breakfast over with first. The
toast and sunny-side up eggs are getting cold.
You're right... Thank you for the meal.

(Arusu is staring at me. I guess she's already
starting her observations. I don't think eating
breakfast has anything to do with love...)

Arusu, why don't you eat too? Well, it's nothing
special. Just toast, eggs, and salad.

Yes. So I should do the same as Kotori Itsuka?
This is the first time I've done something
like this.
Oh... Well I guess so, since you're an AI Spirit.

(Arusu awkwardly picked up a piece of toast and
examined it. So she really is eating a meal for
the first time.)

(Nice... The toast is perfect and the eggs are
pretty good. Arusu is copying us and eating well.)

Okay, so now that breakfast is over, what should
we do next?

We have no option but to behave like we usually
do. We'll go to school and attend classes.

That's all? This is a game world, right? It
doesn't feel like it at all.

(Breakfast tasted so real, even down to how
crisp the lettuce was. It's hard to believe a
program replicated that.)

That's right. But we have no choice but to abide
by her rules. Then Shido, it's best you live
normally in this world. Events will pop up.
Events...

If what she said is true, and this world isn't
much different from normal, your life will
basically be a working gal game.

Well... Guess it's the best environment to find
out what love is.

Love... But this is a gal game. Would you actually
find real love in a place like this...?

Shut up. It's a misconception that love's not real
in a gal game... I think. I mean, what's the point
in complaining about it now?
You have a point there.
Hm? Do you want more toast?
...Yes.

(I no longer felt her gaze on me. She seems to be
totally into the toast.)

Be sure to eat the eggs and salad too, all right?
You can stack the sunny-side up on the toast if
you want. It's good that way, too.
Understood... I will give it a try.

*Sigh*... Luckily, she doesn't seem to want to
hurt us at this moment.
Yeah, I agree.

Shido, you're easy on girls, so I don't trust
your judgement. Since we can't find a way out, if
there even is one, we've no choice but to comply.

You're right. Anyways... What kind of life will
this gal game be?

Beats me. I don't know the particulars of the
events. But I don't think it's that different from
your daily life.
Your life is pretty much a screaming gal game.
Th-That's not true...

(...I guess I do remember Tonomachi saying
something like that to me.)

Anyways, just be your usual self and don't think
about it. I'm sure something will happen whether
you like it or not.
O-Okay... Got it.
*Nom, nom*...
Arusu... seems like a free spirit now.

What are you talking about? She's been like this
from the get-go.
Well, you have a point...
